keyword: calories in glass of white wine
title: Calories in a Glass of White Wine
meta_description: Discover calories in glass of white wine: about 125 kcal per standard 150 ml serving, plus carbs, alcohol content, and variations for different types.
h1: Calories in a Glass of White Wine
assumptions: Standard 5 oz (150 ml) serving of dry white wine (e.g., Sauvignon Blanc), 12% ABV, no added sweeteners.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, sweetness, alcohol content, brand, and serving size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard glass of white wine contains about 125 kcal, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Sweet white wine (e.g., Riesling with higher residual sugar)
Larger pour (200 ml instead of 150 ml)

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of white wine?
faqs.a: Approximately 125 kcal for a standard 150 ml serving of dry white wine.
Yes, about 3.8 g carbs per glass, including 1.4 g sugars; dry varieties have less.

faqs.q: Are there calories from alcohol in white wine?
faqs.a: Most calories (around 100 kcal) come from alcohol; the rest from carbs.

faqs.q: How does red wine compare to white wine calories?
faqs.a: Similar; a glass of red is about 125-130 kcal, depending on type.

faqs.q: What affects calories in white wine?
faqs.a: Sweetness level, alcohol percentage, and serving size; drier and lower ABV means fewer calories.
